Key Match Events: Riley Greene made a spectacular, tumbling catch in the stands to end the Rockies' 5th inning and prevent a further run from scoring.
Greene also hit a solo homer in the 1st inning and a sacrifice fly in the 4th inning to help the Tigers take an early lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager A.J. Hinch praised Greene's big-time play, calling it'spectacular' and saying it was a big-time player making a big-time play.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers' 6-run 1st inning off Rockies starter Tanner Gordon was highlighted by Greene's solo homer.
Greene has been on a hot streak in September, batting 12-for-34 with 5 extra-base hits and 10 RBIs in 9 games.
Others: Greene's injury history has led manager Hinch to give him breaks when possible, but Greene is feeding off the intensity of the games and the crowd.
